title: Perhaps Light at The End of The Tunnel for The Trade War?
text:
PSG Wealth Daily Investment Update, 15 October 2019

The JSE ended lower on Monday tracking a sell-off in European markets after a vague trade agreement made the rounds. At the closing bell, the JSE All Share lost 0.57%.Stocks on Wall Street broke a four-day winning streak on Monday amid contradicting narratives on the US-China standoff. Just after the JSE closed, the lost 0.02%.European indices took a knock on Monday after a vague trade agreement between Washington and Beijing drew mixed reactions from investors. Shortly after the JSE closed, France’s lost 0.40% while Germany’s was down by 0.20%.Hong Kong stocks made gains on Monday as investors cheered signs of progress in the US-China trade war, easing fears of a global recession. The closed 0.81% in the green.Although investors remained troubled over the extent of the damage caused by a protracted trade war, Japanese stocks surged on easing trade tensions between two of the world’s largest economies. At 18h30, the gained 1.15%.The rand lost its footing against the dollar on Monday as investors continued to unravel the latest developments from the US-China trade war. At 18h35 a dollar traded at R14.79.Although short on detail, optimism over a trade deal between Washington and Beijing increased risk appetite and eased the price of gold. An ounce of traded at $1 491.68 at 18h45.Oil prices fell on the back of heightened concerns over slowing global growth and oil demand on Monday. At 18h50 a barrel of traded at $59.17.
